content: Figure 2-7 Rear view of the CPC drawer The CPC drawer logical structure, component connections are shown in Figure 2-8 on page 32. BMC / OSC BMC / OSC PPC PPC 5x FANS PPS Ports Front ETS Ports 6 or 12x PCIe+ Gen3 fanouts and ICA SRs (LG01, LG02 … LG12) PSU1 2x SMP9s PSU2 PSU3 PSU4 SMP Connectors Rear 32 IBM z16 A02 and IBM z16 AGZ Technical Guide Figure 2-8 CPC drawer logical structure Memory is connected to the DCMs through memory control units (MCUs). Up to six MCUs are available in a CPC drawer (one or two per DCM) and provide the interface to the DIMM controller. A memory controller uses eight DIMM slots. The buses are organized in the following configurations:  The M-bus provides interconnects between PUs chips in the same DCM  The X-bus provides interconnects between PUs chips to each other, in the same drawer The A-bus provides interconnects between CPC drawers using SMP9 cables. 2.2.1 CPC drawer interconnect topology The point-to-point SMP9 connection topology for CPC
